main_definition: The only one; unique or unparalleled.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Pertaining to being the sole member or representative of a group, species, etc., without any equals.
meanings_and_examples.example: A company may have a 'sole proprietor' who is the only owner and has no partners.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The only one; used as an adjective to describe something that lacks companions or competitors.
meanings_and_examples.example: He had the sole right to decide his own future, with no advice from others.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refers to a shoe's insole, which is the interior bottom of the footwear designed for comfort and support.
meanings_and_examples.example: She purchased new soled shoes because her old ones were worn out.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A musical term referring to playing or singing a note on its own without any other notes sounding simultaneously.
meanings_and_examples.example: The pianist played the solo part of the piece beautifully, captivating the audience's attention.
